It also asked for an immediate stop to acts of violence in the area, and the lifting of the blockade.<ref>[http://www.losandes.com.ar/notas/2010/5/31/un-493164.asp "Rechazo del Gobierno argentino"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110609072814/http://www.losandes.com.ar/notas/2010/5/31/un-493164.asp |date=9 June 2011 }} (in Spanish), ''[[Los Andes (Argentine newspaper)|Los Andes]]'' 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Bolivia}} Bolivia [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Religion (Bolivia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] issued a statement calling the attack "atrocious", adding that the actions were a flagrant violation of international law and called for an investigation.<ref>[http://www.rree.gov.bo/webmre/prensa.aspx?pagina=np24.htm&ruta=notasprensa/2010/2010_mayo/ "Comunicado del Gobierno Boliviano en Respuesta al Ataque por el Ejército Israelí"]{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} (in Spanish), Press Release, Bolivia Government, 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Brazil}} Brazil's [[Ministry of External Relations (Brazil)|Ministry of External Relations]] issued a statement strongly condemning the Israeli action, calling for an independent investigation and the end of the blockade of the Gaza Strip. Brazil also expressed deep concern over the well-being of one of its citizens, [[Iara Lee]], that was on board the flotilla. They further said that they had instructed the Permanent Representative of Brazil to the United Nations to fully support an emergency meeting of the United Nations Security Council to discuss the Israeli military action,<ref>[http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa/notas-a-imprensa/ataque-israelense-a-201cflotilha-da-liberdade201d "Note 349 – Israeli flotilla attack"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716154144/http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa/notas-a-imprensa/ataque-israelense-a-201cflotilha-da-liberdade201d |date=16 July 2011 }} [[Ministry of External Relations (Brazil)|Ministry of External Relations of Brazil]]. Retrieved on 2010-05-31. {{pt icon}}</ref> and that the Ambassador of Israel in Brasília had been summoned to explain the events.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brazil summons Israeli ambassador over IDF raid|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3897038,00.html|publisher=[[Ynetnews]]|date=31 May 2010}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Canada}} The Canadian [[Office of the Prime Minister (Canada)|prime minister's office]] released a statement saying it "deeply regrets" the loss of life in the Israeli raid on an aid flotilla sailing to the blockaded Gaza Strip and that they "... are currently looking for more information in order to shed light on what exactly happened".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2010/05/31/israel-gaza-aid-death.html |title=Zardari Israel storms Gaza-bound aid ships |publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]] |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref> The [[Edmonton Journal]] asserted its view that Canada's "cautious" approach was the right one as "tragedies involving loss of life in the Middle East invariably provoke reflexive responses from opposing camps". This was despite the arrest of Canadian Kevin Neish.<ref>{{cite news |date=1 June 2010 |url=http://www.edmontonjournal.com/news/Harper+caution+best+reaction/3095691/story.html |title=Harper's caution best reaction |newspaper=[[Edmonton Journal]] |accessdate=2 June 2010 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Chile}} The Chilean [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Chile)|Foreign Ministry]] said in a statement, "Chile condemns the use of the forces in any form."<ref>[http://english.peopledaily.com.cn/90001/90777/90852/7006899.html "Latin American countries condemn Israeli attack against humanitarian aid ship"], [[People's Daily]] Online, [[Xinhua News Agency]], 31 May 2009</ref> Chilean [[Senate of Chile|Senator]] Alejandro Navarro, who was scheduled to be aboard the Gaza aid convoy, denounced the attack as "cowardly and disproportionate against unarmed civilians".<ref>[http://www.mercuriovalpo.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20100531/pags/20100531104556.html "Senador Navarro dice que pudo morir en ataque israelí a flota humanitaria"] (in Spanish), ''[[El Mercurio de Valparaíso]]'', 31 May 2010.</ref> He further stated that Chile "condemns Israel and this event will have multilateral consequences because it set a serious precedent". *{{flagicon|Ecuador}} Ecuador President [[Rafael Correa]] said he recalled his ambassador to Israel for consultations after which the Ecuadorian Foreign Ministry said the ambassador would leave Tel Aviv immediately "as an act of protest against the attack which left civilians killed and injured".<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3898523,00.html "Ecuador recalls envoy; Chavez: Israel a murderer"], [[Ynetnews]], 3 June 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Mexico}} Mexico [[Secretariat of Foreign Affairs (Mexico)|Secretariat of Foreign Affairs]] issued a statement "strongly condemning the Israeli attack on civilian vessels in international waters carrying humanitarian aid". It called for a full investigation.<ref>[http://www.informador.com.mx/mexico/2010/205905/6/mexico-condena-energicamente-ataque-israeli-a-flotilla-humanitaria.htm "México condena 'enérgicamente' ataque israelí a flotilla humanitaria"] (in Spanish), ''[[El Informador (Mexico)|El Informador]]'', 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Nicaragua}} The Nicaraguan [[President of Nicaragua|government]] called the Israeli actions "a clear violation of humanitarian and international law", and suspended diplomatic ties with Israel in protest of the raid.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/world/2010-06/02/c_13328920.htm |title=Nicaragua suspends diplomatic ties with Israel |publisher=[[Xinhua News Agency]] |date=2 June 2010 |accessdate=12 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121106121010/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/world/2010-06/02/c_13328920.htm |archivedate=6 November 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *{{flagicon|Paraguay}} Paraguay Foreign Affairs Ministry issued a statement "condemning" and "strongly rejecting" the Israeli attack on the convoy and supported the United Nations' call for a full investigation.<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.py/noticias_um-309384.htm "Paraguay 'rechaza' y 'condena' ataque israelí a convoy humanitario"]{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} (in Spanish), ''[[La Nación (Paraguay)|La Nación]]'', AFP, 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Peru}} Peruvian [[Ministry of Foreign Relations (Peru)|Foreign Affairs Ministry]] issued a statement condemning Israeli violent attack on the human assistance convoy. Peru disapproves the use of military force based on international rights principles and calls for a full investigation. Peruvian government exhorts to restore dialogue and negotiation in order to reach permanent peace agreements and made an urgent call to the Government of Israel to allow the free flow of humanitarian aid to the people in Gaza Strip<ref>[http://www.rree.gob.pe/portal/boletinInf.nsf/mrealdia/12B0273051E9D49005257735004B7932?OpenDocument "Official notice 002- 10"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100609020730/http://www.rree.gob.pe/portal/boletinInf.nsf/mrealdia/12B0273051E9D49005257735004B7932?OpenDocument |date=9 June 2010 }} (in Spanish), [[Ministry of Foreign Relations (Peru)|Foreign Affairs Ministry]], 1 June 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|USA}} The United States Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]] said, "United States supports the United Nations Security Council's condemnation of the acts leading to this tragedy, and we urge Israel to permit full consular access to the individuals involved, and to allow the countries concerned to retrieve their deceased and wounded immediately. We support in the strongest terms the Security Council's call for a prompt, impartial, credible, and transparent investigation."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/video/#/video/politics/2010/06/01/bts.clinton.israel.gaza.flotilla.cnn?hpt=T1 |title=U.S. Condemns Israel Flotilla Raid |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=16 July 2010 |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> A [[White House]] spokesman cautiously said that the United States "deeply regrets the loss of life and injuries sustained, and is currently working to understand the circumstances surrounding this tragedy".<ref name="alj-blog" /><ref>{{Cite news |first=Glenn |last=Greenwald |date=31 May 2010 |title=Israel attacks aid ship, kills at least 10 civilians |url=http://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2010/05/31/israel/index.html#postid-updateA6|publisher=[[Salon (website)|Salon]] |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref> President Barack Obama told his counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu that he deeply regretted the loss of life in the Israeli raid urged him to quickly get to the bottom of the incident. The White House summarized the President's conversation saying "The president expressed deep regret at the loss of life in today's incident, and concern for the wounded."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/obama-withholds-condemnation-of-gaza-flotilla-clashes-calls-for-clarification-of-facts-1.293387|title=Obama withholds condemnation of Gaza flotilla clashes, calls for clarification of 'facts' |work=[[Haaretz]] |location=Israel |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> In the Senate, Majority Leader [[Harry Reid]] and Minority Leader [[Mitch McConnell]] co-authored a letter signed by 85 other senators arguing for the legality of the blockade and the raid and calling on the President to support Israel.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/105093-87-senators-defend-israel-in-flotilla-incident?page=1|last=Zimmermann|first=Eric|date=23 June 2010|newspaper=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]|title=Reid and McConnell lead letter to Obama defending Israel in flotilla incident}}</ref> Rep. Anthony Weiner of the U.S. congress criticized the flotilla, saying that it had was supported "by some of the worst enemies of peace in that region, and some of the worst enemies, quite literally, not only of Israel, but of the United States as well. And I mean Turkey, Iran, Hamas. These are not entities that were looking for some peaceful resolution here."<ref name="Hill">{{cite news |last=Bogardus|first=Kevin|title=Ally Turkey comes under increasing criticism from some lawmakers|url=http://thehill.com/homenews/house/102891-turkey-alliance-comes-under-increasing-criticism-from-lawmakers|newspaper=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |accessdate=19 June 2010}}</ref> "The complicity of Turkey in launching a flotilla to challenge the blockade in Gaza, the ensuing violence that occurred, the grievous loss of life is deeply troubling to those of us who have supported the U.S.-Turkish alliance in the past," Rep. Mike Pence said on the House floor. "Turkey needs to decide whether its present course is in its long-term interests, but America will stand with Israel."<ref name="Hill"/> In an interview with [[Charlie Rose]], Vice President [[Joe Biden]] defended Israel's decision to intercept the pro-Palestinian flotilla bringing humanitarian aid to the coastal territory, but did not defend the Israel Navy raid itself. He stated, "you can argue whether Israel should have dropped people onto that ship or not[, but Israel] has a right to know whether or not arms are being smuggled in."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/biden-israel-right-to-stop-gaza-flotilla-from-breaking-blockade-1.293833| title=Biden: Israel right to stop Gaza flotilla from breaking blockade |work=[[Haaretz]] |location=Israel |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> Mike Hammer, a spokesperson for the [[United States National Security Council|National Security Council]], said: "The current arrangements are unsustainable and must be changed."<ref name="Al Jazeera Tails">{{cite news|publisher=[[Al Jazeera English]]|title=Israel navy tails Gaza aid ship|date=5 June 2010|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/06/201064235620154213.html|accessdate=5 June 2010}}</ref> The city of San Francisco's [[Board of Supervisors]] was considering a non-binding resolution introduced John Avalos and Sophie Maxwell calling for "condemning the Israel Defense Forces' military attack on the Freedom Flotilla", while also calling on the [[US Congress]] and Obama to continue working to bring peace and security to the Gaza region.<ref>Gordon, Rachel. (10 June 2010)[http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/cityinsider/detail?entry_id=65535#ixzz0qWL9Mg1C City Insider : Israeli flotilla raid lands on supervisors' radar]. ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]''.</ref> *{{flagicon|Uruguay}} Uruguay's Foreign Affairs Ministry condemned the Israeli navy's action, expressed sorrow for the loss of life and demanded a "quick independent investigation and called on the Israeli government for full cooperation".<ref>[http://www.prensa-latina.cu/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=193297&Itemid=1 "Gobierno uruguayo condena ataque israelí"] (in Spanish), [[Prensa Latina]], 31 May 2010</ref> The ministry has also expressed its solidarity with the families of the victims and is asking for the siege on Gaza to end.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.prensa-latina.cu/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=193297&Itemid=1 |title=Gobierno uruguayo condena ataque israelí |publisher=[[Prensa Latina]] |date=1 January 1970 |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Venezuela}} Venezuelan [[President of Venezuela|President]] [[Hugo Chavez]] condemned Israel's "attack on peace activists". He called the attack "an act of war undertaken by the Israeli army against defenseless civilians" who were trying to break through Israel's "criminal blockade".<ref>[http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=128578&sectionid=351020704 "Israel committed an act of war"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100602090019/http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=128578&sectionid=351020704 |date=2 June 2010 }}, [[Press TV]], 1 June 2010</ref> At a rally, Chavez described Israel as "cursed terrorist and murderous state" and further alleged "Israel is financing the Venezuelan opposition. There are even groups of Israeli terrorists, of the Mossad, who are after me trying to kill me."<ref>[http://www.jta.org/news/article/2010/06/06/2739462/venezuelas-chavez-attacks-israel-in-speech "Venezuela's Chavez attacks Israel in speech"], [[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]] (JTA), 8 June 2010.</ref>
;Non-OAS members *{{flagicon|Cuba}} The Cuban [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Cuba)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] condemned the Israeli action, calling it a "criminal attack" and expressed its "most energetic condemnation". Cuba calls for the lifting of the Gaza blockade and reaffirms its solidarity with the Palestinian people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://america.cubaminrex.cu/English/Statements/Articulos/StatementsMINREX/2010/01-06-10.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100715225419/http://america.cubaminrex.cu/English/Statements/Articulos/StatementsMINREX/2010/01-06-10.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=15 July 2010 |title=Statement from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on the Criminal Attack Perpetrated by Israel on the Humanitarian Flotilla |publisher=america.cubaminrex.cu |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010}}</ref> Former Cuban President [[Fidel Castro]] condemned Israel's attack on the Freedom Flotilla as "Nazi fascist fury". Adding that the Israeli commandos who boarded the ships fired "frenetically" at the aid workers. he then asked "Is it possible [for Obama to be re-elected] without the Pentagon of ... Israel ... use nuclear weapons against Iran?"<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=128842&sectionid=351020702 |title='Israeli attack was Nazi fascist fury' |publisher=[[Press TV]] |date=3 June 2010 |accessdate=3 June 2010}}</ref>
==Asia== *{{flagicon|Bangladesh}} Bangladesh's Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated, "Bangladesh is shocked and saddened at the unwarranted attack on unarmed civilians on board the ''Mavi Marmara'' on 31 May 2010, and the resultant loss of lives." The Ministry also said that Bangladesh expresses its profound condolences and sincerest sympathy to the bereaved families, and joins in prayer for the eternal peace of the departed souls. Bangladesh also called for collective international action to end the siege immediately and to allow the people of Palestine to return to normal life.<ref>{{cite news |author=Zhang Jin |url=http://english.cri.cn/6966/2010/06/01/1461s573834.htm |title=Bangladesh Condemns Israeli Attack on Freedom Flotilla |publisher=[[China Radio International]] |date=1 June 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Brunei}} Brunei [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (Brunei)|Foreign Minister]] [[Pengiran Muda Mohamed Bolkiah]] condemn the recent Israeli raid on Gaza-bound Turkish aid ships. In a joint statement with other ministers of the second Asean-Gulf Cooperation Council (Asean-GCC), he condemn the act of violence in international waters and expressed condolences to the victims of the raid and expressed solidarity with the people and government of Turkey and other countries. The ministers also urged the immediate release of those who are still held hostage by the Israeli authorities and called for the removal of the Israeli blockade in accordance with the relevant UN Security Council resolutions, in particular [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1860]]. With the recent raid, Israel has once again created additional hurdles to the Middle East peace process which is currently entering a critical phase with the launch of "proximity talks". The ministers agreed there is a need for international cooperation to ensure that Israel is held accountable for its action in accordance with international law and urged the United Nations to conduct a thorough investigation of the Israeli attack in order to ensure its accountability.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bt.com.bn/news-national/2010/06/02/hrh-condemns-israel-raid-gaza-aid-flotilla|title=HRH condemns Israel raid on Gaza aid flotilla|newspaper=[[The Brunei Times]]|date=2 June 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140715135200/http://www.bt.com.bn/news-national/2010/06/02/hrh-condemns-israel-raid-gaza-aid-flotilla|archivedate=15 July 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> *{{flagicon|China}} China [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China|Foreign Ministry]] spokesman [[Ma Zhaoxu]] condemned Israel's raid on the international convoy and urged Israel to seriously implement UN Security Council resolutions and improve the humanitarian situation in Gaza.<ref>[http://english.cri.cn/6909/2010/05/31/2021s573541.htm "China Condemns Israel's Attack on Gaza Aid Flotilla"], by Zhang Xu, [[China Radio International]], [[Xinhua News Agency]], 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|India}} India's Ministry of External Affairs released a statement strongly condemning the attack by Israeli forces. "India deplores the tragic loss of life and the reports of killings and injuries to people on the boats carrying supplies for Gaza. There can be no justification for such indiscriminate use of force, which we condemn. We extend our sympathies to the families of the dead and wounded. It is our firm conviction that lasting peace and security in the region can be achieved only through peaceful dialogue and not through use of force."<ref>[http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/india-news/india-condemns-israeli-attack-on-pro-palestinian-peace-activists_100372987.html "India condemns Israeli attack on pro-Palestinian peace activists"], Thaindian News, 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Indonesia}} Indonesian president [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]] condemned Israeli action.<ref>{{cite news|title=Presiden: Indonesia Siap Bertindak Aktif untuk Kemerdekaan Palestina|date=2 June 2010|url=http://www.republika.co.id/berita/breaking-news/nasional/10/06/02/118113-presiden-indonesia-siap-bertindak-aktif-untuk-kemerdekaan-palestina |newspaper=[[Republika (Indonesian newspaper)|Republika]] |location=Jakarta |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> Foreign Minister [[Marty Natalegawa]] also condemned the action and said that the Israeli blockade in Gaza is a violation of international law.<ref>{{cite news|title=Indonesia urges UN to investigate Israeli attack|date=31 May 2010|url=http://www.antaranews.com/en/news/1275320018/indonesia-urges-un-to-investigate-israeil-attack|publisher=[[Antara (news agency)|Antara]]|location=Jakarta|accessdate=1 June 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100606035347/http://www.antaranews.com/en/news/1275320018/indonesia-urges-un-to-investigate-israeil-attack|archivedate=6 June 2010|df=dmy-all}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Iran}} Iran Supreme Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Sayyid [[Ali Khamenei]] condemned Israeli actions, and said is Israel is more brutal than Fascists.<ref name="farsnews">{{cite news|title=Leader: Zionists More Brutal than Fascists |url=http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=8903111783 |date=1 June 2010 |publisher=[[Fars News Agency]]}}</ref> Iran president [[Mahmoud Ahmedinejad]] said that the incident was an "inhuman action of the Zionist regime against the Palestinian people" and that it would bring the regime "closer than ever to its end".<ref name="bbc-reaction">{{cite news|title=Reaction to Gaza aid ship deaths|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/10196351.stm|publisher=[[BBC News]] |date=31 May 2010}}</ref> The Iranian government has called for a boycott of Israel.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2010/5/31/worldupdates/2010-05-31T153846Z_01_NOOTR_RTRMDNC_0_-489340-1&sec=Worldupdates |title=Iran calls on world to cut ties with Israel |newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]] |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110622033336/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2010%2F5%2F31%2Fworldupdates%2F2010-05-31T153846Z_01_NOOTR_RTRMDNC_0_-489340-1&sec=Worldupdates |archivedate=22 June 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Iran's Supreme National Security Council (SNSC) Secretary [[Saeed Jalili]] underlined the necessity for coordination among regional and Islamic states to confront the Zionist regime of Israel effectively.<ref name="farsnews2">{{cite news|title=Iranian Top Security Official Urges Regional Coordination to Confront Israel |url=http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=8903111589|publisher=[[Fars News Agency]] |date=1 June 2010}}</ref> Iran's Foreign Ministry condemned the raid, saying "the incident once again revealed the criminal and war-mongering nature of the Zionist regime." Iran also called on the UN Security Council and the OIC to take swift punitive action against Israel.<ref>[http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90777/90854/7007194.html "Iran calls for UN, OIC's punitive action against Israel"]. People's Daily Online.</ref> At an Asian security summit in [[Istanbul, Turkey]] on 8 June 2010, Ahmadinejad stated that the raid "showed violence and hatred and war-mongering attitudes. The devilish sound of the uncultured Zionists was coming out from their deceit.... They were holding up the flag of the devil itself." He also claimed that the raid would accelerate the end of Israel, stating, "[The raid] has actually rung the final countdown for its existence. It shows that it has no room in the region and no one is ready to live alongside it. Actually, no country in the world recognizes it, and you know that the Zionist regime is the backbone of the dictatorial world order."<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/meast/06/08/iran.ahmadinejad.security.summit/index.html?hpt=T2 "Iran's Ahmadinejad slams 'devilish' Israel"], [[CNN]], 8 June 2010.</ref> *{{flagicon|Japan}} Japan [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] issued a statement stating that it is "shocked at the report that people aboard boats carrying supplies to the Gaza Strip were victimized as a result of confrontation with Israel Defense Forces. We deeply deplore the casualties and the injuries of many people. Japan condemns the violent acts which caused this tragic incident." It also expressed deep condolences for the affected families and urged a full investigation into the matter.<ref>[http://www.mofa.go.jp/announce/announce/2010/5/0531_02.html "Statement by Ministry of Foreign Affairs, on the Confrontation between Israel Defense Forces and Activists"], [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)]], 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Malaysia}} Malaysia [[Deputy Prime Minister of Malaysia|Prime Minister]] [[Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak]] stated, "in the name of the Malaysian government and the people strongly condemn this inhumane, brutal aggression by the Israeli regime on the flotilla which is bringing humanitarian aid to the beleaguered people of Gaza." He added "the whole world should condemn the action of this cruel regime," and "hoped the incident will result in a censure on Israel".<ref>[http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v5/newsindex.php?id=502515 "Malaysia Calls On UN Security Council To Censure Israel Over Attack On Ship"], [[Bernama]], 1 June 2010</ref> Malaysia's government also urged Israel not to take any action that could harm people aboard the Malaysian-funded ''MV Rachel Corrie'', which would carry its citizens. Foreign Affairs Minister [[Anifah Aman]] said Israeli authorities should ensure a safe passage for the vessel to deliver its humanitarian cargo.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/06/20106451226156655.html "Another aid ship on way to Gaza"]. [[Al Jazeera English]] (4 June 2010).</ref> *{{flagicon|Maldives}} The Maldives Ministry of Foreign Affairs released a statement expressing its great sadness at the incident and extending condolences to those affected. It condemned "in the strongest possible terms" the attack on civilians. The Maldives joint calls for an international enquiry and for those responsible to be held accountable. It also urged an immediate end to the blockade of Gaza.<ref>[http://www.foreign.gov.mv/v3/?p=news&view=sep&nid=3254 "Statement by the Maldives on the Israeli Aggression against the Flotilla carrying Humanitarian Aid"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722223333/http://www.foreign.gov.mv/v3/?p=news&view=sep&nid=3254 |date=22 July 2011 }}, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of the Maldives, 1 June 2009</ref> *{{flagicon|North Korea}} North Korea's Foreign Ministry condemned Israel for having "mercilessly killed or wounded dozens of civilians aboard the boats". It went on to call the attack a "crime against humanity perpetrated at the U.S. connivance and under its patronage and a blatant challenge to the Arabs including Palestinians and the Mideast peace process". The statement also "expresses full support and solidarity with the cause of the Palestinians and other Arab people[s]".<ref>[http://www.kcna.co.jp/index-e.htm "News From Korean Central News Agency Of Dprk"]. Kcna.co.jp. {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/5jiMECr2I?url=http://www.kcna.co.jp/index-e.htm |date=11 September 2009 }}</ref> *{{flagicon|Pakistan}} Pakistan strongly condemned the Israeli action, calling it a cruel act and an open violation of international laws and ethics. Foreign Minister [[Shah Mahmood Qureshi]] stated, "Pakistan strongly condemns this incident. Our point of view was that there was no moral or legal reason for this attack." The Pakistani government also expressed deep concern over the well-being of Pakistanis and journalists on board and Pakistani missions are in touch with Arab countries of the region to get information about the status of the Pakistani nationals in the flotilla.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/updates.asp?id=105799 |title=Pakistan condemns Israeli raid on Gaza aid boat |newspaper=[[The News International]] |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2010}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> President of Pakistan [[Asif Ali Zardari]] and Prime Minister of Pakistan [[Yousuf Raza Gilani]] strongly condemned the Israeli actions. They further said that the [[Government of Pakistan]] is exerting all its efforts to find out what had happened to the Pakistanis aboard the flotilla.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://geo.tv/5-31-2010/65904.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100603191934/http://geo.tv/5-31-2010/65904.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date= 3 June 2010 |title=Zardari condemns Israel for aid ship brutality |publisher=[[Geo TV]] |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2010 |df= }}</ref> *{{flagicon|South Korea}} The Government of South Korea downgraded Israeli President Shimon Peres' visit to 'working' status.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ravid |first=Barak |url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/south-korea-downgrades-president-shimon-peres-visit-to-working-status-following-flotilla-debacle-1.294571 |title=South Korea downgrades President Shimon Peres' visit to 'working' status following flotilla debacle |work=[[Haaretz]] |location=Israel |date=2 April 2008 |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Sri Lanka}} The Government of Sri Lanka condemned the attacks saying it deeply regrets the loss of life and injuries resulting from this operation and condemned the indiscriminate use of force to prevent the carriage of supplies for people under occupation, and reiterates its conviction that sustainable peace and security in the region is achievable only through peaceful dialogue.<ref>{{cite news |author=Gamini Gunaratna |url=http://www.colombopage.com/archive_10A/Jun02_1275503298CH.php |title=Sri Lanka deplores Israeli attack on Gaza bound aid flotilla |publisher=ColomboPage |date=2 June 2010 |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Tajikistan}} Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Tajikistan condemned the Israeli attack on humanitarian aid convoy in international waters and called for international investigation of the incident.<ref>[http://avesta.tj/index.php?newsid=5022 МИД РТ осудил нападение Израиля на «флотилию мира»], Avesta Information Agency.</ref> *{{flagicon|Uzbekistan}} The foreign minister of Uzbekistan condemned the Israeli attack, and called on Israel to lift the blockage of Gaza.<ref>[http://en.trend.az/news/politics/foreign/1697566.html "Uzbek FM condemns Israel's attack on humanitarian convoy of ships"], [[Trend News Agency]]</ref> *{{flagicon|Vietnam}} Vietnam cancelled scheduled visit of Israeli President Shimon Peres after the flotilla incident.<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/06/21/AR2010062104706_pf.html "Israel's feeling of isolation is becoming more pronounced"], ''[[The Washington Post]]''.</ref>
A summit at the [[Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia]] a statement agreed to by 21 of the 22 participants at the conference (Israel being the 22nd) read "All member states, except one, expressed their grave concern and condemnation for the actions undertaken by the Israeli Defence Forces." In response [[Turkish President]] [[Abdullah Gul]] said the near-unanimous condemnation showed Israel was isolated and that it "will suffer the consequences for its mistake against Turkey".<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/06/201068165042815907.html "Israel condemned at Turkey summit"]. [[Al Jazeera English]] (15 June 2010).</ref>
==Europe== ;{{Flag|European Union}} The [[President of the European Parliament|President]] of the [[European Parliament]], [[Jerzy Buzek]] called it "an unjustified attack" and said, "it is a clear and unacceptable breach of international law, especially the fourth [[Geneva Convention]]. We demand that Israel explain its actions immediately, with the utmost transparency, and guarantee full accountability by co-operating with any full inquiry that is to be set up." **Other members of the European Parliament described Israel's actions using words such as "obscene", "kidnapping", "revulsion", and even "terrorism".<ref>{{cite news |last=Phillips |first=Leigh |url=http://euobserver.com/9/30185 |title=EU parliament discourse on Israel boils over after flotilla attack |date=1 June 2010 |publisher=[[EUobserver]] |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> [[High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy|EU foreign affairs chief]] [[Catherine Ashton]] demanded Israeli authorities mount a "full inquiry" into the deaths on the flotilla.<ref name="alj-blog">{{cite news |last=Carlstrom|first=Gregg|title=Aftermath of Israel's attack on Gaza flotilla|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=31 May 2010|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2010/05/31/aftermath-israels-attack-gaza-flotilla|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120525025130/http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2010/05/31/aftermath-israels-attack-gaza-flotilla|dead-url=yes|archive-date=25 May 2012|accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref><ref>[http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/breaking-news/eu-to-hold-urgent-talks-over-gaza-raid/story-e6frf7jx-1225873737180 "EU to hold urgent talks over Gaza raid"], ''[[Herald Sun]]'' (Melbourne, Australia), AFP, 31 May 2010</ref> She also appealed for the opening of the border so humanitarian aid can get through.<ref name="poland"/> The ambassadors of the 27 EU members said "The EU condemns the use of violence that has produced a high number of victims among the members of the flotilla and demands an immediate, full and impartial inquiry into the events and the circumstances surrounding it. EU does not accept the continued policy of closure, it is unacceptable and politically counterproductive, we need to urgently achieve a durable solution to the situation in Gaza."<ref name="aljaz">{{cite news |date=3 June 2010 |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2010/05/20105316216182630.html |title=Global outrage over Israeli attack |publisher=[[Al Jazeera English]] |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Belgium}} Belgium's foreign minister, [[Steven Vanackere]], called the use of Israeli force "disproportionate"<ref>[http://www.tijd.be/nieuws/politiek_-_economie_internationaal/Wereld_reageert_geschokt_op_Israelische_aanval.8921726-3143.art?ckc=1 "World shocked after Israeli attack"], (in Dutch), ''[[De Tijd]]'', 31 May 2010</ref> and "invited the Israeli ambassador to explain how the events unfolded".<ref>[http://www.expatica.com/be/news/belgian-news/belgium-invites--israeli-ambassador-to-explain--gaza-raid_72314.html "Belgium 'invites' Israeli ambassador to 'explain' Gaza raid"], [[Expatica]], Agence France-Presse, 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Bulgaria}} The Bulgarian Foreign Ministry demanded the immediate release of two Bulgarian journalists travelling in the convoy.<ref>Nick Iliev, [http://www.sofiaecho.com/2010/05/31/909227_two-bulgarian-journalists-arrested-by-israeli-forces-during-gaza-aid-convoy-operation "Two Bulgarian journalists arrested by Israeli forces during Gaza Aid convoy operation"], ''[[The Sofia Echo]]'', 31 May 2010</ref> In addition, Bulgaria "slammed" the attack, saying "nothing can justify the violence that resulted in the killing of over 10 people on board one of the ships." It called for an investigation.<ref>[http://www.focus-fen.net/index.php?id=n221378 "Bulgaria summons Israeli ambassador over flotilla raid"], Focus Information Agency.{{dead link|date=August 2016}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Cyprus}} In Cyprus, Israel's ambassador was summoned to the Foreign Ministry to explain the operation. Cyprus stated its belief that NGOs must be allowed to do their work freely and lawfully. Further, it called for the lifting of the blockade of Gaza.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mfa.gov.cy/mfa/mfa2006.nsf/All/6783FAD649EDFB6CC2257735002120A8?OpenDocument |title=Press Release by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs regarding the events in the southeastern Mediterranean |publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Cyprus)]] |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *{{flagicon|Czech Republic}} Czech foreign ministry spokesman Philip Kanda said [[Prague]] is not planning to issue separate statements to the event because it agrees with the observations of the EU foreign minister [[Catherine Ashton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://translate.google.com/translate?js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&layout=1&eotf=1&u=http://www.ceskenoviny.cz/tema/zpravy/predseda-ceskeho-senatu-konvoj-do-gazy-byl-planovanou-provokaci/485826&id_seznam=80&sl=cs&tl=en|title=The 2010|url=http://politiken.dk/politik/article983529.ece|language=Danish|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100608055731/http://politiken.dk/politik/article983529.ece|archivedate=8 wished for a quick recovery for all the injured in the incident. Estonia also called for a thorough investigation of the incident, and expressed concern over the situation.<ref>[http://www.vm.ee/?q=en/node/9536 "Statement of Foreign Minister Urmas Paet Regarding Incident with Aid Ships Headed to Gaza"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110525025130/http://www.vm.ee/?q=en%2Fnode%2F9536 |date=25 May 2011 }}. [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Estonia)]]. 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Finland}} Finland [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Finland)|Foreign Minister]], [[Alexander Stubb]], expressed "shock" at the Israeli commando raid and called for an explanation of the incident and on the circumstances surrounding it. The Israeli Ambassador to Finland was called to the Foreign Ministry over the incident. He called for an investigation and for Israel to lift the blockade of Gaza.<ref name=UNSC>[http://www.salem-news.com/articles/may312010/un_emergency.php "UN Security Council Holds Emergency Session on Israel's Deadly Interception of Aid Convoy"], Salem-News.com, 31 May 2010.</ref> [[File:Demonstration against the Israeli attack on ship to Gaza May 31st 2010 (4).jpg|thumb|4000 people gathered on Gustav Adolfs Torg in [[Gothenburg]], Sweden, in support of ''Ship to Gaza''<ref>{{cite news |author=Madeleine Sahlman|url=http://www.gp.se/nyheter/goteborg/1.380323-protest-samlade-tusentals |title=Protest samlade tusentals -Göteborg|language= sv |newspaper=[[Göteborgs-Posten]] |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref>]] *{{flagicon|Croatia}} Croatian President [[Ivo Josipović]], expressing deep regret over the loss of lives and injuries, gave condolences to the families of the deceased, and strongly condemned the use of violence.<ref name="IvoJosip">{{cite news|title=Statement of the Office of the President |date=1 June 2010 |url=http://www.predsjednik.hr/01062014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100725192425/http://www.predsjednik.hr/01062014 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 July 2010 |publisher=[[President of Croatia]] |df= }}</ref> Croatian [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration (Croatia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration]] expressed regret over the loss of lives and gave condolences to the families of the deceased. It additionally underscored the need for refraining from escalation of the conflict, calling for an investigation that will meet international standards, and expressed hope that this incident will not hamper the recently restarted Middle East peace process. Furthermore, it emphasized the need for humanitarian aid access to the civilian population of the Gaza Strip.<ref name="MVPEI">{{cite news|title=PRIOPĆENJE ZA JAVNOST broj 261/2010 |date=1 June 2010|url=http://www.mvpei.hr/custompages/static/hrv/templates/_frt_Priopcenja.asp?id=5779 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130218054131/http://www.mvpei.hr/custompages/static/hrv/templates/_frt_Priopcenja.asp?id=5779 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=18 February 2013 |language=Croatian}}</ref> As a member of NATO, Croatia activated an emergency decision-making mechanism.<ref name="crtimes">{{cite news |url=http://www.croatiantimes.com/news/General_News/2010-06-02/11375/Croatia_responds_to_Isreali_raid_on_humanitarian_flotilla |title=Croatia responds to Israeli raid on humanitarian flotilla |date=2 June 2010 |publisher=[[Croatian Times]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100605075042/http://www.croatiantimes.com/news/General_News/2010-06-02/11375/Croatia_responds_to_Isreali_raid_on_humanitarian_flotilla |archivedate=5 June 2010}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Iceland}} The Foreign Minister of Iceland, [[Össur Skarphéðinsson]], condemned the attack saying, "Gaza is in fact a giant prison where international law is violated. This must stop,"<ref>[http://visir.is/ossur-fordaemir-framferdi-israela/article/2010519889386 "Össur fordæmir framferði Ísraela"], [[365 (media corporation)|Visir.is]] 31 May 2010 (Viewed 31 May 2010).</ref> and "We support the demands that have been made, e.g. by the EU, that this matter be thoroughly investigated. It is intolerable that Israel repeatedly exerts force in this way."<ref>[http://www.ruv.is/frett/fordaemir-arasir-israela "Fordæmis árásir Ísraela"], [[RÚV]] 31 May 2010 (Viewed 31 May 2010).</ref> *{{flagicon|Norway}} Norway's Prime Minister, [[Jens Stoltenberg]], said "a military attack against civilian activists is totally unacceptable."<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/05/20105316216182630.html "Outrage over Israeli attack"], [[Al Jazeera English]]</ref> Foreign Minister, [[Jonas Gahr Støre]], has called for a meeting with the Israeli ambassador to Norway.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dagbladet.no/2010/05/31/nyheter/utenriks/aksjon/jonas_gahr_store/israel/11941087/|title=Støre: – Sjokkert over Israel |newspaper=[[Dagbladet]] |date=31 May 2010 |language=Norwegian |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref> Protests also spontaneously erupted in a number of cities throughout Norway.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nrk.no/nyheter/distrikt/rogaland/nord-jaeren/1.7147195 | title=Her protesterer de mot Israel |publisher=[[NRK]] |date=31 May 2010 |language=Norwegian |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.adressa.no/kultur/article1488465.ece |title=Viste sin avsky mot Israel på Torvet |newspaper=[[Adresseavisen]] |date=31 May 2010 |language=Norwegian |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref> A group of 12 Norwegian Members of Parliament wore Palestinian scarves to a session of the Norwegian Parliament as a "show of solidarity with the Palestinian people".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.vg.no/nyheter/utenriks/midtosten/artikkel.php?artid=10008067 |title=Israel-protest i Stortinget – VG Nett om Midtøsten |publisher=[[VG Nett]] |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> On 4 June, the [[Norwegian Armed Forces|Norwegian military]] canceled a seminar that included a speech by an Israeli soldier.<ref>[http://www.cknw.com/News/World/Article.aspx?id=216322 "Norway cancels military seminar slated to include Israeli officer following Gaza flotilla raid"]. [[CKNW]]. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110926233033/http://www.cknw.com/News/World/Article.aspx?id=216322 |date=26 September 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3899084,00.html |title=Global protests target flotilla raid |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=20 June 1995 |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> It was reported immediately after the raid that 43 percent of Norwegians either would like to boycott Israeli products, or were already doing so.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.swedishwire.com/nordic/4831-norwegians-ready-to-boycott-israel |title=Norwegians ready to boycott Israel (The Swedish Wire, June 2, 2010) |publisher=Swedishwire.com |accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Russia}} Russia's President [[Dmitry Medvedev]] called for a thorough investigation of the incident and said that, in any case, the deaths of people are irreversible. Prime Minister [[Vladimir Putin]] condemned the assault and expressed concern that it was conducted in international waters.<ref>{{cite news |date=8 June 2010 |first=Amy |last=Teibel |title=Israel Launches Investigation Of Deadly Flotilla Raid |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/06/08/gaza-blockade-israel-laun_n_604004.html |publisher=[[The Huffington Post]] |accessdate=8 June 2010}}</ref> On 8 June, Putin condemned the acts and said it has to be investigated specially, especially since it was on international waters.<ref>[http://www.jpost.com/International/Article.aspx?id=177868 "21 Asian nations: Israel join NPT"]. ''[[The Jerusalem Post]]''</ref> The Foreign Ministries of Russia and the EU adopted a joint statement concerning the flotilla attack, which correlates with the UN Security Council activity in the situation.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://english.ruvr.ru/2010/06/01/8879319.html |title=Death of people in Israeli attack unjustified – Medvedev |publisher=[[Voice of Russia]] |accessdate=6 June 2010}}</ref> Russia's [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Russia)|Foreign Ministry]] expressed "condemnation and profound concern" over the incident and called for a full investigation. It also called the use of "use of arms against civilians and the detention of the vessels on the high seas without any legal grounds constitute a gross violation of generally accepted international legal norms".<ref>{{Cite press release |url=http://www.mid.ru/Brp_4.nsf/arh/D383242A209FAA29C325773500293C15? |title=Incident with "Humanitarian Convoy" for Gaza |publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Russia)]] |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=8 June 2010 |quote=Moscow voices condemnation and profound concern in this connection, especially in view of the deaths and injuries among the "humanitarian convoy" participants}}</ref> The head of the Russian [[State Duma]] Foreign Affairs Committee, [[Konstantin Kosachev]], called for an "urgent meeting" of the [[Middle East Quartet]] to discuss the incident.<ref>[http://rt.com/Top_News/31 May 2010/gaza-aid-israel-attack.html "Up to 19 reported killed as Israel disrupts Gaza humanitarian effort"]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[RT (TV network)|RT]], 31 May 2010</ref> *{{flagicon|Serbia}} The Serbian [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Serbia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] condemned the excessive use of force that caused the deaths of innocent civilians. It also endorsed the UN Security Council's call for an immediate and impartial investigation into the incident.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.srbija.gov.rs/vesti/vest.php?id=66198 |title=Serbia endorses investigation of attack on flotilla carrying aid to Gaza Strip|publisher=Government of Serbia |date= 1 June 2010|accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> On 23 June 2010 at a summit of Balkan countries in Istanbul, Serbia was one of the countries that strongly condemned Israel's attack on the aid flotilla as well as the loss of life.<ref name="sofiaecho1"/><ref name="seecp-turkey1"/> *{{flagicon|Switzerland}} Switzerland called for an international inquiry and summoned the Israeli ambassador.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748704490204575279222111875404?mod=googlenews_wsj |title=International Reaction to the Israeli Raid |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date= 31 May 2010|accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Vatican City}} The [[Holy See]] expressed "great concern and pain" about the incident.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.corriere.it/notizie-ultima-ora/Esteri/Medio-Oriente-assalto-israeliano-pacifisti-Vaticano-preoccupato/31-05-2010/1-A_000108445.shtml |title=Medio Oriente: assalto israeliano a pacifisti, Vaticano "preoccupato" |work=[[Corriere della Sera]] |date=31 May 2010 |language=Italian |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref>
==Oceania== *{{flagicon|Australia}} [[Australian prime minister]] [[Kevin Rudd]] and MPs{{Clarify|date=June 2010}}<!--How many? or Which?--> condemned the Israeli raid.<ref>[http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/news-211789-100-australian-prime-minister-and-mps-condemn-israels-aid-convoy-attack.html "Australian prime minister and MPs condemn Israel's aid convoy attack"], ''[[Today's Zaman]]'', 3 June 2010. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100604005323/http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/news-211789-100-australian-prime-minister-and-mps-condemn-israels-aid-convoy-attack.html |date= 4 June 2010 }}</ref> Rudd stated "The Australian government condemns any use of violence under the sorts of circumstances that we have seen."<ref name="aljaz2">{{cite news |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2010/06/2010618503229683.html |title=Global rallies continue over Israel |publisher=[[Al Jazeera English]] |date=1 June 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> Australia's Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade said it was "deeply saddened by loss of life following the incident".<ref>[http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-national/australians-on-aid-flotilla-are-safe-20100531-wqsj.html "Australians on aid flotilla are safe"], Australian Associated Press, ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'' 31 May 2010</ref> Prime Minister [[Kevin Rudd]], speaking during a media conference, said the Government was "deeply concerned" by the turn of events and called for "a full investigation" and for the results to be brought before the United Nations Security Council (UNSC).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2010/06/01/2915244.htm?section=world |title=Rudd condemns aid flotilla violence |publisher=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |date=1 June 2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010}}</ref> *{{flagicon|New Zealand}} New Zealand Foreign Affairs Minister [[Murray McCully]] condemned the Israeli attack, and urged restraint from all parties. "Representatives from our Mission in New York [are] attending the emergency meeting of the [[United Nations Security Council]] and we will continue to follow their deliberations carefully."<ref>[http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/PA1006/S00001.htm "NZ condemns Gaza flotilla incident"], [[Scoop (website)|Scoop]], 1 June 2010</ref> Israel's ambassador to New Zealand [[Shemi Tzur]] was later summoned to a meeting with McCully who stated that: "I left him in no doubt about the seriousness of the Government's concerns in relation to the incident off Gaza."<ref name="Stuff.co.nz_3763089">{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/politics/3763089/Flotilla-raid-McCully-meets-Israeli-ambassador |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120913200951/http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/politics/3763089/Flotilla-raid-McCully-meets-Israeli-ambassador |dead-url=yes |archive-date=13 September 2012 |title=Kiwi being held by Israelis identified |date=1 June 2010 |agency=[[NZPA]] |publisher=[[Stuff.co.nz]] |accessdate=4 November 2011 }}</ref>
==See also== *[[Reactions to the Gaza flotilla raid]] *[[International reaction to the Gaza War]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2017}} {{Use Indian English|date=August 2017}} {{Infobox holiday |image =sirimanu.jpg |caption =Sirimanu of Pydithalli Ammavaru |official_name = Sirimanothsavam |date = The first Tuesday after [[Dussehra]] |observedby = People of [[Vizianagaram]] Devotees comes from various parts of [[Andhra Pradesh]] and [[Orissa, India|Orissa]] |observances = Tholellu, Sirimanothsavam, Uyyala Kambala, Pydithalli Theppotsavam on Pedda cheruvu |type = Village festival |date2018 = 23rd October 2018 |relatedto = P V A V S Bhanu Raja(Asst Commissioner) }} [[File:Press meet During festival.jpg|thumb]] '''Sirimanothsavam''', ({{lang-te|సిరిమాను పండుగ, సిరి మాను ఉత్సవం}}) (also referred to as ''Sirimanu Uthsavam'', ''Siri Manu Fete/Festival'', ''Sirimanu Panduga'') is a festival organized to propitiate Goddess '''Pyddithallamma''' of [[Vizianagram]] Town. ''Siri'' means ''lean and small'' and ''manu'' means ''stump'' or ''stick''. The priest of the temple, while taking procession between the fort and temple three times in the evening, hangs from the tip of the long, lean wooden stick (measuring 60 feet), raised high into the sky. The priest possessed by the goddess would himself tell a few days before, where this ''manu'' is available; from there only, this has to be procured.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reviewstream.com/reviews/?p=6029 |title=Pyditalli Ammavari temple |author=krishnakomali |publisher=Reviewstream.com |date= |accessdate=2014-04-15}}</ref> Hanging from the upper end of the stick, which is raised high into the sky, is a very risky exercise, but the grace of the Goddess, it is believed, saves the priest from falling. It is organized in the month of September or October (Dasara) of every year. It is a stupendous event attended by two to three lakhs of people from the neighboring towns and villages.<ref>[http://www.hindu.com/2008/10/01/stories/2008100153080300.htm The Hindu English Daily], 2008-10-01</ref> The Rajas of Vizianagaram would be overseeing this event. The APSRTC runs about 250 buses from different parts of the state to facilitate transport of devotees to Vizianagram to attend this festival.<ref>[http://www.hindu.com/2008/10/12/stories/2008101251810300.htm The Hindu English Daily], 2008-10-12</ref>
== History ==
It was during 1757, when the king '''Puspati Peda Vijaya Rama Raju''' of [[Vizianagaram]] was busy in the [[Battle of Bobbili]], second Anand has taken the charge of crown and died in the year 1760. His wife also died along with him in [[Sati (practice)]]. Then the wife of Peda Vijaya Rama Raju, Rani Chandrayamma has adopted Vijaya Rama Raju who belongs to [[Vizianagaram]] dynasty as per history.
If we go through the history of 104 temples constructed by Vizianagar Sanstan some history of those temples can be known by virtue of their location. But there is no specific history about the Sri Pydithalli Ammavaru temple constructed by this sanstan. But as per rumours or by some stories it is seen that Pydithalli Ammavaru is a Grama Devata of Vizianagaram. Some say that this Ammavaru is a sister of Maharanis of Vizianagaram. But there are many evidences that Pydithalli Ammvaru belongs to Vizianagaram dynasty. Even though there are no perfect proofs regarding birth and other details of Pydimamba, as per the peoples saying, after completion of Bobbili battle after Vijayadasimi on the next Tuesday and idol was found in the west side of Pedda Cheruvu of Vizianagaram. It is known Pyidimamaba, the village goddess of Vizianagaram.
It was in 1750 when the French leader [[Marquis de Bussy-Castelnau]] was staying with entire battalion near [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]]. Many soldiers have died due to some disease (Masuchi). He was running with financial crisis. Peda Vijaya Rama Raju of [[Vizianagaram]] helped him to overcome financial crisis and rebuild his battalion. In 1756 Bussy visited [[Rajahmundry]]. It is heard that Vijaya Rama Raju has given a warm welcome to Bussy by going in front at [[Rajahmundry]].
At that time Bobbili Maharajas were ruling with full power. There are some differences between Bobbili Maharajas and Vizianagaram Rajas regarding power. Because of those differences and some reasons [[Battle of Bobbili]] started in 23 January 1757. During the battle entire Bobbili fort got destroyed and many Bobbili soldiers died in the battle. The wife of Vijaya Rama Raju and Sister Sri. Pydimamba tried to stop the battle by hearing the news and were not succeeded. By that time only Sri Pydimamba sister of Vijayaramaraju was suffering from Masuchi disease. While she was in the puja of Goddess she came to know that Vijayaramaraju is in trouble. She wanted to inform her brother regarding this and tried to convey the message through Vizianagaram soldiers, but every one was in the battle. She started with Patiwada Appalanaidu to convey the message in a horse cart. But, by that time, she got the news that his brother Vijaya Rama Raju died in the hands of TandrapapaRayudu. She felt unconscious. Patiwada Applanaidu sprinkled water over her face and she came to conscious stage and told Appalanaidu that she will not live more. She is going to engross her soul in Goddess. Her statue will be found at the west bank of Pedda Cheruvu (A pond located at the heart of [[Vizianagaram]] lies on the west side of [[Vizianagaram]] Fort). The fishermen found the idol of Pydimamba and constructed a temple called Vanam Gudi for goddess, at [[Vizianagaram]] Railway Station which was the first temple for Pydimamba, the second temple is located at three lamps junction.<ref name="Jataras">[http://vizianagaram.nic.in/Jataras.html] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120223203651/http://vizianagaram.nic.in/Jataras.html |date=23 February 2012 }}</ref>
== Procession == [[File:Procession of the Sirimanu.jpg|thumb|250x250px|Procession of the Sirimanu]] Every year on the first Tuesday passing Vijayadasami Sirimanu Utsav is being celebrated. Sirimanu means a big tree. It is believed that approximately 15 days before
of Sirimanu Utsav goddess Pydimamba would come in the dream of temple Pujari and tell him where the Sirimanu for this year is located. Pujari would go in search of sirimanu and will cut the sirimanu with performing puja etc. That sirimanu can be located anywhere. The owner must agree to cut his tree for Utsav. That tree will be shaped neatly into Sirimanu and will be placed over the chariot. This sirimanu will be brought to Three Lanters junction around 2:00 pm. At around temple Pujari will make darshan of Goddess and will sit on the Sirimanu chariot. This sirimanu will move 3 times to Vizianagaram fort and temple between 3:00 pm to 4:00 pm. The Vizianagaram rajahs will sit on the top of the fort and watch the Utsav. Pujari will be given new clothes by Rajas and puja is performed. In front of Srimanu there will be a chariot in the shape of White elephant.<ref name="Jataras" />
== Importance of the White Elephant ==
Many people do not know about the White Elephant moving in front of Sirimanu chariot. But in the olden days Maharajas used to sit on a white elephant and participate in Sirimanu Utsav. Now as per the present situation white elephant statue is being moved in front of Sirimanu as a part of tradition.<ref name="Jataras"/>
[[File:Anjali Chariot.jpg|thumb|182x182px|Anjali Chariot in Sirimanothsavam]]
== Importance of Anjali Chariot ==
Sri Pydimamba died before getting married. So five Married women were made sit on the Anjali chariot which is on the front of Sirimanu as a part of tradition. As five married women are sitting on this chariot, this is called Anjali chariot. Secondly along with this sirimanu Paladhara, an umbrella made with fishing nets decorated with flowers and fruits is important.<ref name="Jataras"/> [[File:Fishermen's net.jpg|thumb|Fishermen's net in Sirimanothsavam]]
== Importance of Paladhara and Fishermen's net ==
As per history when Goddess statue will be found in west side of pedda cheruvu, Patiwda Appalanaidu has tried to bring the statue out by calling professional swimmers of Yata Veedhi. They agreed to bring the statue out with out taking money on putting a condition that their people will participate with srimanu utasav with umbrella made of fishing nets. Patiwada Appalanaidu agreed to their condition and made the rajas convinced for allowing them to participate in Sirimanothsavam.<ref name="Jataras"/>

Farrell |nickname= |allegiance={{flag|United States}} |branch=[[United States Army]] |serviceyears=1916–1946
1950–1952 |servicenumber=0-227201 |rank=[[File:US-O8 insignia.svg|30px|alt=two silver stars]] [[Major general (United States)|Major General]] |commands= |unit= |battles=[[World War I]]: *[[Battle of Cantigny]] *[[Aisne-Marne Offensive]] *[[Spring Offensive#Gneisenau|Battle of Montdidier-Noyon]] *[[Meuse-Argonne Offensive]] *[[Occupation of the Rhineland]] [[World War II]]: *[[Burma Campaign 1944–1945]] *[[Bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki]] *[[Occupation of Japan]] |awards=[[Distinguished Service Cross (United States)|Distinguished Service Cross]]
[[Distinguished Service Medal (U.S. Army)|Army Distinguished Service Medal]]
[[Legion of Merit]] (2)

[[Croix de guerre 1914–1918 (France)|Croix de guerre]] (France) |relations=[[Barbara Vucanovich]] (daughter)
